column4: about installing ubuntu to a 32MB RAM machine... I managed to get the base system installed, but grub failed to install....
what should I do?
is it possible to install that drive from another machine?
you could reboot into 'expert' mode on the installer and select the 'write mbr with grub' option
the grub installer hangs
you can't reboot into expert mode?
select install mbr from the menu
could I install grub from a floppy?
probably not
is there some way I could extract GRUB from the installation cd?
it's already extracted
what happens when you run the grub menu item?
I don't understand you
ok, so I am in the middle of the installation process...
no
and grub fails to install
reboot into the installer in expert mode and select the grub option
the grub installer freezes at 0% and just stays there...
are you sure the CD is ok?
the cd worked on another comp...
does it pass the verifiation stage
no.. but there's a menu item to check the CD's integrity...
try it
integrity check shows that the disk is fine...
